intro: Hoya palawanensis subsp. palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan Waxplant, is a species of flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy, often variegated leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It is a climbing or trailing plant that thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and rarity, it is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant.
